page.title: 06LAND USE - FORESTRY
page.content: Delamere/Eddisbury {LAND USE-FORESTRY As mentioned in the general review a large portion of our area is covered by forest.This forest is called Delamere Forest.The name means forest of the meres,& is actually 2400 acres in size.(970 hectares).It is the only remaining area of the great Mara & Mondrum forests,used in Norman times as a hunting ground by the Earls of Chester.The topography has been altered by glacial activity which formed deep holes creating the present day meres & mosses. Delamere is the management centre for the Cheshire Forest District & from here the Manager & his 30 foresters control forest operations,give advice to private woodland owners & act as plant health inspectors for imported timber.
